Calls on people randomly sometimes. E-textbook comes w/ online hw access code. Online hw is weekly/easy. Grades participation/attendance. Nice woman.

It was hard for me to understand her because she spoke in decently fast Spanish the whole time, no English; and she taught lessons at a really fast pace so I was usually lost in class; heavy on participation in groups and calls on random people to speak in front of the class but she does care a lot about helping her students learn

I am a person who has extreme anxiety about language classes. Alfaro though was understanding and worked with me to get the most out of class despite my anxiety. She has lots of students she teaches every day, but she went out of her way to help me because she cared about me learning Spanish that much. She is the definition of a great teacher.

speaks fluent spanish throughout the entire class session, so be super tuned in as to not miss anything she says. nice, lots of opportunities for points, tries to make the class engaging, doesn't lecture the entire time, gives lots of time in small groups for activities. gotta keep up with homework and graded assessments.

Great professor, our class became tight-knit which made it more fun to come every day. We spoke almost solely in Spanish, which was intimidating at first, but I feel like I actually did learn a lot of the language. There's daily written homework and weekly online homework, but they're not difficult at all.

You can tell she really cares about her students and, although she is a native speaker, she speaks slow enough that a third semester spanish student should be able to catch most of what she is saying.
I am so shocked but some of the negative reviews. She was warm, funny, and caring. I thought that she was an amazing teacher and went out of her way to make sure that we understood the concepts.

Don't take her if you actually want to learn the language. She's mediocre. You won't understand the concepts because she explains them in Spanish. She speaks fast because she's a native speaker so get ready to not understand.

I got placed into 1102, and this is my second Spanish class at OSU. Overall, Maria is by far a better prof than the one I had for 1102. Her course is structured and organized well. For those who didn't understand her in class: did you not ask her for repetition or help? She is extremely reasonable and generous outside of class.

This class was not good at all, she did not take any time to make sure students were catching on. Her power points make no sense and she does not like to answer questions at all. She does not give you clear answers and gets annoyed if you do not know the correct answer.

This is arguably the worst class I have ever taken. Maria could honestly care less about "teaching." This class is her reading straight out of the textbook and talking extremely quickly in incomprehensible Spanish. She would spend all of 2 minutes on brand new vocabulary and then say "got it?" with blank stares from everyone as a response.

She's a tough grader but very helpful. You can improve your grade because there are so many grades in this course. Doing the homework every week and every night is the easiest way to get an A. It's not a hard class and she's a very clear instructor; however, the class is taught in all Spanish. She does speak slowly enough to be comprehensible.

Great instructor but tough grader. Basically, just know the readings from the book for exams. I would recommend taking a class with Mara, I think it improved my overall Spanish speaking skills. You need the textbook. Homework is 20% of your grade & everything comes from the textbook.

Nice, passionate teacher, but extremely tough grade. She is willing to help out if you ask, but she will still mark off points for almost anything. I compared my composition to a student with another teacher and the grading was night and day. He had half of what I wrote and had mediocre sentence structure and received 10 points better on his comp.
Just know the readings. She'll basically tell you whats on the exam, but essaysshort answers strictly graded for grammar. If you know spanish decently well you'll do fine.

Best professor you could have for spanish 3! She is the most helpful and  very intelligent.  She will prepare you the most for your exams! Do the homework, and come to class. Visit her during office hours if you need help, you won't regret it!
She's a great teacher and speaks at a rate that is understandable without being overly dumbed down. You'll do well if you come to class and do the homework.
Since she's an authentic Spanish speaker, she grades a bit more harshly than other 104 teachers. She definitely knows more, though.

Great teacher. Strong accent, but spoke clearly enough for students of any level to understand. Attendance was taken on a daily basis, but class was fun to attend. Homework was graded, but easy enough to keep the workload low. Overall, a great course.
A fun teacher who keeps the classroom happy. An easy class, but you have to show up and do the homework (but the hw is easy). Her accent is authentic but still understandable.

She was a very personable and friendly teacher.  Prior to her class, I had bad experiences in Spanish classes, but she was very organized, and I felt we accomplished a lot during class.  She spoke slowly enough that we could comprehend, but fast enough that she wasn't patronizing.  She really took in interest in teaching and getting to knnow us.

Awesome teacher. Really tried to help her students. Clear about the material and really enjoyed what she was doing. We had a lot of fun lectures and she brought in food for us for cinco de mayo!! Do the homework and attend class and you're guaranteed a decent grade!
Nice teacher. Very strict on attendance. Does in-class activities, to take up class time because there was too little material to make last 10 weeks. Do the homework, and you'll do fine.

If you're looking for a class to get a GE credit, just dont take this one. The quizzes are obscurely hard, and lectures dont help with the exam material. It's manageable if you put in a lot of work and he's a cool guy. U have to watch a 2 hour films every class. Wouldnt advise taking this unless you are deeply deeply passionate about the subject.

Probably the worst professor I have had. The quizzes/exams you take have either extremely vague questions or questions that require depth that he didn't teach you. Very lecture heavy but at the same time he was talking about nothing useful to you or the tests. Overall he does not prepare you for anything, and does not help you even when asked.

Dr. Davidson is a pretty cool dude. Hes clearly passionate about Germany. While he doesnt take attendance, he will tell you one quiz answer in class, so you should probably go. He does his best to communicate effectively, but he doesnt always get the point across. He is caring and will help you understand should you or the class have trouble.

I took his German Film and it's the best course I've ever taken. He's very encouraging but challenges you to push the envelop at the same time. I forgot to send the feedback form back to his department so I guess I'll say some good things about him here...
Not bad.
Nice guy.  Very interesting course.

Really knows what he's talking about and is very fair. Shows films that are different examples of the various film movements, not the same ones you see in every film class, which is a nice break. Very knowledgeable about film! Probably my favorite film professor so far.

Don't bother bringing up any concerns you might have with this guys' techniques (vague, online multiple choice questions where a simple mistype can drop your grade) because he'll just insult your ability to take notes. The material is interesting, but the incessant droning of the prof (and the lack of concern for students) will eventually annoy you

Shows alot of clips instead of entire films, which sucks.Nice guy, doesn't require a textbook.  Pretty funny, never rude. Ambiguous questions on quizzes and worksheets but you can normally guess the right answers if you've lightly skimmed the reading.Take home final! I'd reccomend his class, it's not hard and it's interesting if you like film.
Davidon's okay.  He's very knowledgable about Germany and film.  He doesn't really seem overly helpful, he's interested in doing his own thing.  Take home midterm and notes on final.
Likes to lecture a lot, but exams and papers are very easy. He is fair when it comes to grading and opinions.

The worst thing about this class is the number of "know it alls" that try to answer every question Davidson poses.  Those of you in the WI05 session, you know who you are.  The class is pretty boring because it lasts for two hours, but it also can be interesting.  Take home midterm/final cheat sheet
Davidson seems to be generally uninterested in helping students. The material he covers is very vauge and the tests even though take home are extremely difficult.
extensive knowledge on subject, willing to provide additional materials for clarification
Very smart man, interesting class with a great teacher.
TA promised to help me catch up, when I was absent for family emergency.  My grade suffered unncecessarily.

She is very clear in what she wants and what is important to know. Main thing is go to class! The subject matter is pretty interesting, and the tests were so easy, I got 100 on all the exams and quizzes. Definitely take this for an easy lit GEC if you are willing to take thorough notes and are interested in Italian culture.
I don't know how anyone could stay awake during this class. Literally the most boring class of all time.

One of my favorite profs at OSU. She's passionate about what she teaches and it shows. Gives extra credit to people for speaking up during class discussions. The tests are basically open-ended, but not difficult if you attend class and take notes. If you explain your answers she tends to give you most if not full credit.

She's pretty amazing at conveying the material and make it easy to follow the concepts of the Inferno. I completely suggest this class to anyone interested in Dante's Inferno or an easy GEC grade. Just take plenty of notes and you'll be gold.

I loved her class.  Just make sure you take notes tarting the first day of class because it's all you have to go off on for the midterm and final.  Not too hard tho.  So interesting.  Take her class for a GEC
Amazing amazing amazing! Take her...she is great at making students understand the importance of Italian culture. Great GEC class...highly suggest taking her!

This class was AWESOME! I actually enjoyed going to class! Webb is an awesome teacher! She gives a study guide for quizzes and exams. You only get tested on what she says in class so you do not really need to read the books. Very easy A. Definitely take this class!!

She is easily one of the best professors in the Italian department. She's always willing to help with any issue. Her classes are fun and always interesting. You'll have to put forth some effort but it's always worth it. She's an active scholar outside of teaching so taking her class is not only smart, it's a privilege.

Prof. Webb is amazing. This class was a joke and the quizzes and tests were very straight forward. But class attendance is must and also make sure to write down everything that she tells in class coz they appear on the exams and quizzes. I would recommend this class to nyone
Pretty easy class, if you go to class and take notes you don't have to do the readings.  Interesting literature and movies, she opens up the floor a lot which makes it more interactive...
Great teacher. Interesting stuff, too! I highly recommend this class if you need a GEC...
She is one of the best professors I have had here.  The tests and quizzes are very easy if you go to class and pay attention.  It was also very interesting.

Loved this class! Everything I needed to know for tests and quizzes was presented clearly in the notes. Go to class for the info and you won't even need to read. She is very enthusiastic and apporoachable.

One of the best classes I've taken this year. Organized class structure and excellent use of different mediums to show the material (ie powerpoints, movies, pictures). Learning is easy in her class because she is very interested in Italian culture and art and it spreads to her students. Great class and great professor.

Incredibly easy class; she's very, very kind and always willing to clarify.  An easy A, basically.  Her take on Dante does veer off of the traditional path, though.  She also might want to take Bible 101 because she got quite a bit incorrect regarding the basics of Christianity (ANY Christian denomination, esp. medieval Catholicism).

Prof. Webb is a GREAT teacher who really tries to make class fun.Her knowledge of Dante is amazing.She speaks Italian beautifully, and her lectures are very interactive.She is VERY approchable and kind.Always willing to help. TAKE HER.
She is amazing!  She makes class fun and the matrial exciting!  You'll become an Italian Major after one class with her.  She is also very smart and funny.  You'll love her.
I Loved Heather, she was amazing, definately take a class with her, it's delightful!!

Dr.Webb is an all around must have professor.  She is brilliant, funny, young and engaging.  She makes class fun.  You don't even realize how much you are learning because she makes it so painless.  She is great at what she does and the best professor by far in the languages, if not at OSU.  Take anything and everything you can with her.  She is fabulous.
No Comments

She speaks perfect flawless italian. U'll be totally immersed in italian in her class. She encourages students to think for themselves and her class is a lot of fun. More teachers like this are needed at the lower level, so that students don't get to 402 without being able to actually pronounce Ital
She was actually the sweetest professor ever. She had to leave midway through the year due to a family emergency, but I loved her class, and I am so glad I took it over Spanish or French.

She is very kind and understanding towards students. She makes sure to help each student individually and helps everyone understand Hindi the best she can. Her lectures are engaging, and she makes Hindi so much easier to learn. The course focused mostly on writing, but this is good since it allowed us to build a good foundation for speaking.
excellent, kind and compassionate

Professor Willging was very kind and passionate about what she does. She is easy to understand and learn from in class and creates an environment conducive to learning, however, for being a 2101 class it was HARD. There were many people in my class who were fluent in French and still found that their papers and quizzes were graded too harshly.

Heavy work load out of class. Especially for a three credit hour class that most people are taking for a GE credit. Extremely long readings that are never discussed. Do NOT recommend taking this class. She is a nice person overall, but a terrible professor.

Professor Willging is  very nice and clearly cares about what she does. That being said, she relies heavily on the textbook which seemed to have no real information other than short stories and poems in french. I did not feel I really learned all that much, and I found her class to be kind of boring. She also cold calls on people, which sucks.

Prof Willging challenges her students, but she is extremely fair. You will learn a lot from her class if you put in the time and effort, but it's not unreasonable. Yes, this is upper division French, you have to speak in class, but if you speak 1 or 2 x per class and have good attendance, you will get an A. She is kind and funny. Loved her!

Professor Willging clearly cares about her students and does her best to improve their learning experience and performance in class! Participation is important in this class, but she's very kind and helps you feel comfortable answering questions and speaking. She also gives a good mixture of grammar, reading, and discussions for assignments.

Prof. Willging is the kindest professor I've had at OSU. She's always willing to explain difficult topics and she presents the material in a way that makes it fun. Exams are pretty straightforward and essays are graded fairly. Participation matters, but I have no complaints.

Dr. Willging is amazing and her lectures were really helpful and funny. She's a joy to be around. There's vocab and reading quizzes every now and then, but if you pay attention in class and do the review sheet, you'll do well. She doesn't grade too hard on the essays.

I love Mme Willging. I had a one on one with her and she let me vent to her. She is relatable and understands her students. She really loves her job as well. She is challenging but you CAN do well if you study. You MUST participate in class and take notes, she sees all. Very down to earth and knowledgable. You will learn a lot.

If you want an A in this class you have to put in the effort; read the book, write the papers, study for the quizzes. Graded on papers, quizzes and participation along with two group projects. Not a terribly hard class, but stay up to date and you'll be fine. She really does care about her students and makes the class interesting with discussion.

Dr. Willging was the best French professor I've had at OSU. The readings assigned in her course were difficult, and took quite a while to get through, but everything you needed to know for the tests was discussed in class. Exams were extremely fair and she always respected your opinion, as long as you could support it.
Professor Willging is the best.  She teaches excellently.  She is chair of the department, and does a great job.

She is a very professional woman and its clear she is good at her job. She is good-natured and very kind to students, but definitely challenges you. She is very helpful in all her feedback and really cares to make you better. she is direct and even when she is talking about abstract things, she does her best to make things clear.

She's not an easy A. I ended up barely ever doing the readings and getting by. There's a class discussion on them every class. The tests are kind of hard even with the review. I always got a B or C on them and I studied. If you're talkative this will get you far. You have to write 2 papers. She's a good prof and she's patient with everyone.

You have to talk in this class or else you'll get a horrible participation grade. It doesn't matter if you understand what everyone else is saying, you take notes, etc. You'll get no participation grade. YOU HAVE TO TALK! It's stupid. Plus her exams are hard. You really have to study for them. She thinks she's an amazing lecturer, but she's not.

I do not like this professor's methods. She is more interested in style than substance, in terms of writing. Discussions are very superficial and she expects people to know stuff that is never explained clearly. Expectations are not well outlined. Not particularly tough grader, but picky about little insignificant things. Didn't learn from her.

Prof. Willging is great. She does a good job of trying to break down complex ideas for beginners. She's also quite patient considering that she has to repeat herself a lot. I don't want to linger too much on comments about her appearance but she dresses very well, her style is nice.
I've had several grad classes with her. She's the best thing since sliced bread. And hot.
Dr. Willging was an extremely enthusiastic teacher and very patient with this intermediate-level French class.

Loved her and her class. She is genuinely interested in helping students. If you attend class and listen, her tests require little studying. She makes material relevant and interesting. Favorite professor I've had at OSU.
Great teacher, I feel like I've learned a lot from her.  Can be tough but is still fair and understanding.
Prof Willging is a great teacher, and shes super chic!
Tough, but if you give a damn or try at all, she's there for you.

Loved her class.  She was easy to understand and made lectures fun.  A lot of reading was required, but the subject matter was generally really interesting.  Tests and quizzes weren't too hard. Overall, she's a great professor, and I'd really recommend taking a class with her!

Such a great teacher. Even if you go in to the class hating French, you'll come out with at least a better appreciation for the language. She makes learning about a language interesting, and she has an amazing ability of keeping the students engaged. I definitely reccomend her!
Excellent class with hard but very rewarding books.  Definately worth taking classes from her no matter whether you are a beginner or a grad student.
she really knows her stuff
I love her!  She is one of the best professors I have had at OSU.  She's tough but fair and if you work in class you'll do fine.  I completely loved her class.

I thought this class was hard, but am I ever glad I took it! She's a very cool(& SMART) lady who helps kids who want to help themselves. She covered topics that were really interesting. Whether you want to or not, you will learn something from this prof.
She is so sweet and loves to teach.  By the end of this class I could read French soo much better!
Prof Willging is smart, funny, and can analyze literature like there's no tomorrow.  Plus she's a babe.  Learn French just so you can take her classes!

JJ was the best instructor I've had. He is truly caring and kind, he made classes extremely fun. He made me feel excited to learn as he is very expressive and entertaining. He also explains concepts very well. Super understanding and accommodating. Little homework but a lot of exams, which aren't difficult.

John Bechhold, JJ, is the best professor I had all of college. He is passionate about teaching and makes learning fun. I had him for ASL 1101 and 1102, I wish I could have him again for 1103. He cares about his students and is always willing to go the extra mile to help you. He made learning a new language fun and lectures were always engaging.

I WISH JJ was teaching my section of ASL 1103 next semester. This class was so fun and JJ was an amazing professor. He truly cares about students and their well-being and is always willing to help. He made class interesting and I learned so much from him beyond just ASL vocabulary and syntax. This is what a foreign language class should be like.

JJ was an amazing instructor. It can be scary trying to learn a new language and step out of your comfort zone but he made it a fun environment. I was excited to go to class even if it was early in the morning.
JJ is awesome. He's very ready to help students, and makes learning easy and fun. Get ready to take tests, that's most of what your grade is.

J.J. was an AMAZING professor. He truly cared about his students and their wellbeing. I would love to have him as a teacher again. He broke everything down and was very compassionate with anything that would happen.
Amazing professor! Cares about his students and wants you to learn. Attendance is not mandatory but is important if you want to do well in the class. Would 1000% have him as a professor again.

Dr. Dinca's Spanish 1103 class was an outstanding experience! His teaching style is engaging and dynamic, making complex concepts easy to understand. He fosters a supportive environment that encourages participation and builds confidence. With his clear explanations and passion for the language, I left the class feeling inspired and proficient.

Professor Dinca was a fair and clear professor.  I knew the expectations and when my internet crashed the night I was taking my final, he responded to my email for help.  If you are honest and clear he will reciprocate.

Took Spanish 1101 with Prof. Dinca this fall at CSCC. I was really wary about taking an online language class, but I honestly didn't have any problems. I came in with literally zero Spanish language knowledge and still did fine in the class. He really cares about his students and even reached out to me when I wasn't doing well.

Professor Dinca was an absolutely wonderful Spanish teacher. It was very plain that he had less interest on testing/quizzing us (although that was obviously part of the class) and much, much more interest in getting us to engage with the Spanish language. He also taught us a lot about culture which I really enjoyed.

Dr. Dinca is an outstanding professor. Ignore the negative reviews below because learning a language online isnt easy and he gives you all the opportunities to learn and do really well. You have to be ready to put in the effort and time. He is super nice and will even go out of his way to give you second chances if you mess up a quiz or assignment

Based on previous reviews he may very well be a good professor in the classroom, but Dinca's online class has been a complete disaster. The Blackboard page is wildly disorganized, and finding the homework assignments/directions is actually harder than doing the homework.

One word to describe him: UNORGANIZED. He made everything more complicated than it should be. It's so easy to get lost within his already loaded system. If it takes you 2 hours to finish all the homework, it will take you an extra hour to just find assignments and follow the poorly worded directions. Just a total mess. AVOID AT ALL COSTS.

Avoid this professor at all costs. I don't understand why people are even giving him good ratings. His online course is poorly organized, and the directions to everything is vague. He doesn't teach rather, he forces us to teach ourselves and then makes us record ourselves speaking. I will repeat, AVOID HIM AT ALL COSTS.
Good guy, soft spoken. Gives great insight about the Spanish language and makes it interesting.

Professor Dinca is a really nice guy. He cares a lot about helping students learn new languages. He is an easy grader and everyone can get an A in his class if you show up. One of his only downsides is he never posts grades.

Dinca is a polyglot so he really knows his stuff. Awesome teacher, really cares about his students. We had a problem towards the end of the semester where he was half an hour late every day, but I liked him enough to the point where I didn't care. A solid choice if you're looking to learn a new language! (This was at CSCC)

Professor Dinca has been my best Spanish teacher I've had so far. He is funny and his lectures are good and he keeps it interesting. Attendance is mandatory, but that is a University rule. Workload is easy and he is very generous when it comes to late assignments and grading. 10/10 I would definitely take his class again. Go Bucks!

Dr. Dinca was one of the best professors I have had at Ohio State. He molds his class so he is able to connect with his students on an individual basis, unlike most college professors. His style of teaching is easy to learn from and is not overly difficult with grading. All in all, I loved Dr. Dinca's class and would prefer to have him again.

Prof Dinca is honestly the nicest Professor Ive ever had. I missed 2 oral exams and a midterm due to a car crash and going out of town and he always worked with me. Email him to talk it out. Professional yet relatable. Super nice & always went the extra mile. Id def take his classes again. Will help on things past due if you ask. A+

I had him for Spanish 2, and he was very vague about assignments, so many people would do them wrong. He never posted grades and made inappropriate jokes. Did well in the class because material was easy, but he was extremely frustrating and took away from learning experience.

He is the most caring and compassionate prof. Ive ever had . He is thorough with his Spanish and makes class fun and innovative . He is the type to inspire someone to want to persue language . I would recommend his class to any student eager to learn and feel lucky to have been in his class .
He is a great professor he really encouraged he to continue with Spanish he was a great help ������������

Dr. Dinca was a really nice guy. We cared about him and he cared about us. The class wasn't difficult but I still felt like I learned a lot. He would do some weird things, like make you repeat what you said to the person next to you to the whole class. Other than that, my whole class liked him.

His teaching was fine, and he's pretty nice. If you talk to your neighbor in class, he will make you repeat what you said to the entire class, which is a bit odd. Also, he doesn't answer emails, and he rarely puts grades in, so you don't know how you're doing. His class wasn't difficult at all, though.

I had Dr. Dinca at CSCC and it was one of the easiest classes I've ever had where I still learned something. He's incredibly lenient and patient. I'm convinced the only way to fail is to actively TRY to fail. The homework was fun and the lectures were engaging. By far the best Spanish teacher I've ever had and I would recommend him to everyone.

Take him if you can. He is a nice guy, gives straightforward assignments. Study for tests exactly like he says. Tests are never hard or tricky. He is pretty good about working with your schedule. He can be boring, but if you participate just a little bit voluntarily, he will appreciate it. He's also encouraging, which is nice.
Made class very interesting
Professor Dinca was a great teacher that made learning Spanish surprisingly easy.
Great lecturer. He creates an open classroom environment where you get to practice your Spanish and learn from others. Only complaint is that grading time can be a little lengthy.

I took his Spanish 3 class and he was extremely helpful. Always made sure to clarify when someone didn't understand something. You have online homework every week and there's occasionally another assignment. His tests are relatively easy if you review for them. If you skip class consistently, your overall grade is deducted.

Daniel is a great instructor. His Spanish class was one of the first classes that I took at OSU. It was a great experience. While it is a challenging course, having an instructor like Daniel who truly cares about his students makes it worth while. Expect to be challenged, expect to have hard days, but expect to learn a lot. Highly recommended!

What you put in is what you get out, so be prepared to talk in Spanish frequently. Dinca is fair and provides feedback.  Show up and pay attention and you'll do well. As for Dinca, he's a nice guy and genuinely wants each student to do well. He makes himself available if you need extra practice or instruction.

You miss class you miss a lot. He's also the type to ask a question and not move on until it's answered. We haven't really mastered any new vocabulary. Or he'll tell you to do an assignment in class and just walk out of the room. He tries to do assignments he thinks are fun but aren't. Needless to say I count the seconds on the clock.

Nice guy and lenient grader. Things that "bugged" me about him was that 1)  he never emails you back and 2) takes forever to give back midterms (took 1 month to give back midterm 2). He also wasn't very clear about the oral report so ask plenty of questions a couple of weeks before it. Other than those complaints, I would recommend him!

Make sure you make a good impression on him. If he likes you; he will grade your stuff more leniently. Overall he is a great teacher though and is, generally speaking, an easier grader than most 1103 professors.
He is probably the best teacher I have ever had, he teaches the topic with interest. Definitely recommend him.

Daniel is a pretty good professor. He is just very slow on getting you your exams back and your in-class quizzes. The Spanish department develops the curricula. He randomly collects homework and tells you things are due, and then doesn't collect them. Kind of annoying in that sense. Other than that, hes a good teacher.

Yes, the department basically organizes the curriculum, but there were things such as promising a progress grade report and then never handing it out that really got on my nerves. He does wait a long time to give quizzes back, and randomly decides to check or collect homework.

Fairly easy class, but sometimes he did not cover what would be on the exams. Also gave us a large assignment with just three days to complete it when other instructors gave their class a few weeks notice. Takes forever to grade exams and doesn't answer questions without having to "check with the department." Not a bad teacher, but some complaints

Daniel is a great guy. Yes he takes a while to get your exams and work graded but if you go to his office hours he will grade them for you on the spot. He only assigns the HW that is helpful and necessary (which is very little) and he is a very kind man. Just show up, do the homework most days, and study a little and you should do fine.

he was a good teacher, always willing to help, he encouraged us to email him and visit him during office hours. the thing that got to me was that he never handed back our last in class exam or even gave us an idea of what our grades were before the final.

I took 103.66 with him. He was always helpful, even if there were times I forgot to do my homework. He can delay a bit on grading and handing back tests and such. He doesn't use Carmen or post grades, but he encourages people to utilize his office hours to find that sort of thigns out. Overall, I'd take him again if I had the opportunity. Nice guy.

Very helpful if you approach him. He is willing to take time out and go over exams, assignments, and other things as long as you take the time out to do this, too. Overall, was a great teacher. Would suggest him.

The foreign language department makes the tests, so the difficulty is not his fault. He prepares you well for his class and lets you know what will be on the test for you to study. He gives homework often and uses the book every day, so buy the book. He is OFTEN late to scheduled events and gives test results out WEEKS after you've taken the tests.

Daniel is one of the most approachable, and easy going teachers I have had a OSU so far (and I just finished my Junior year). His homework assignments are not tough or time consuming. His class setting is laid back and participation oriented and he gets to know his students real well. A lot of these posts are out dated. Great teacher and great guy

I would absolutley reccomend daniel for spanish class. His teaching is very speaking oriented and you learn on the go and work a lot with partners. He assigns very fair homeworkd, and is also a very fair grader. He is very approachable and easy to talk to about class and problems.

Most of these reviews are out dated. Dinca is a really cool and laid back guy. He always makes time for students. He had a review right before the final exam and stayed after the review to help us with out review guides. He is an easy grader and very encouraging. As long as you participate in class and it will be enjoyable.

I thought he was an awesome teacher.  He was really funny and let us have fun while we learned spanish.  He was always available to help students before and after class, even though he was late a couple of times.  He's an awesome person to get to know and was probably my favorite teacher my first year.  I would definitely recommend him

It was hard to understand him. He set deadlines for homework but hardly ever collected it. He wasn't prepared at all. He gave us little time to prepare for conversation tables. He would email us our assignments, but we wouldn't get them until after midnight the night before class. He complained a lot and got off subject.

Wow. I must have had a different professor. He emailed our homework assignments to us the night before they were due, never actually graded any of our homework assignments, didn't finish covering all of the material in class and complained about his apartment the whole quarter. Seriously, he does not prepare his students for future classes.

Danny is probably the best spanish teacher I've had.  He will do anything for his students in order for them to succeed.  I took the class last spring and he is still helping me with spanish a year later.  I went on to 240 and 250 and got A's. Dinca is a cool guy and his dedication to his students transcends that of any teacher I've had at OSU.
No Comments

His classes are really laid back and he makes them fun and not too stressful.  BUT he's not the greatest teacher in the world.  If you're looking to go past 104, I wouldn't recommend him because he doesn't prepare you well enough for future classes. If you're lookin for a fun time, he's your man.
Not too much work. Hard to undersatnd, but so are allot of TA's. Funny sometimes, jokes are ok but they sometimes get in way of actual class.
Good teacher, not overly difficult, but that's because i'm ok with Spanish. Not too prepared but quickly rebounds. Nice guy.
No Comments
Not a good teacher.Did not follow the book and very unorganized with teaching new material. I took his class twice and still did'nt help me for the next level.
Should not even be teaching. I was totally unprepaired for the next class. Also late and return test weeks later.Do not schedule him as your teacher.
worst teacher i ever had. His english is so hard to understand. And made jokes that are not even funny. He always stares at you and it scared me
He's a good guy.  Good classroom environment.  Kept the class fun and interesting.  Wish I had him for my other two.
Dinca is the MAN. Always there for his class, and he's the most laid back guy at OSU. He totally rules the school.

Professor Trenta is an overall great professor. I am currently a CCP student and I had her for SP1102 as a summer course. Overall she always made sure we understood all the new grammar and vocabulary words we were learning and was easily accesible outside of class. Just be preprepared for the quizzes and midterms as they hold a lot of weight.

I loved coming to class every morning because Laura was the instructor. She made the environment so comfortable that we all felt safe to use Spanish without worrying about if we were saying everything correctly. There are no quizzes or tests, just one weekly homework assignment. There is a final presentation but she prepares you for success.

I had her my freshman year here at OSU when I used to be a psych major. All of her lectures were amazing and she always kept the class interested. Even though I would show up to class sometimes with 2hrs of sleep, she always kept me interested haha. She was genuinely interested in teaching and genuinely cared about her students. 10000/10 prof.

I have had many language professors, and she is the best! She understands we are learners and really takes the time to help us learn. She grades by making sure you hit the required points, but considers the effort you put into the class.

Kuwai-sensei is the best teacher I've had, hands down. She makes it difficult to not care about class, and it was well worth taking at 8am five days a week. All the TA's are great. Daily performance is 60% of the grade. Would 100% recommend for learning Japanese
We love Kuwai-Sensei :)

Kuwai-Sensei and all the other TA's are amazing! I had her for JPN 1 and it was a small but awesome and energetic group. Mon,Tu, Thu, Fri class will be in Japanese, and Wed class will be in English. If you show up, prepare for all the activities beforehand, and don't give up, you'll have a lot of fun! Can't wait to take JPN 2!

Class is taught in Japanese 4 days a week for a grade, and Wednesday is always taught in English. Instructions on what parts of the textbook to study are posted clearly; practice the scripts and the activity book diligently. The TAs are very helpful when they teach, and Kuwai-sensei is a very welcoming professor. Watch out for the FACT quizzes.

Kuwai-sensei and the entire Japanese language department truly cares about their students. They make learning the difficult language a much better experience. The class itself is difficult for sure. Japanese is one of the hardest for English speakers to learn so be weary.
Very easy and interesting class. The grade is based on a lot of things, and the daily grade is 60% or something. So preview the script and vocab and show up.
Easy grader, very kind. Teach with passion and very kind. I enjoy her class and have the power to learn more about Japanese.

Kuwai-sensei is such a sweetheart. She truly wants her students to succeed and takes notice of effort regardless of results. The class is difficult and composed mostly of acting out scripts with your peers, but sensei helps a lot if you get lost or confused about the material. She typically teaches once/week, but the other teachers are amazing too.
Kuwai is absolutely wonderful, for the like, 40% of the semester she actually teaches, since they rotate grad students and such. I wish she taught the upper levels as well.

Kuwai-sensei is such a caring teacher, it's hard not to love her. You'll have a host of TA's in the lower-level classes, and they can all be pretty variable, but Kuwai-sensei is a real gem. She's very understanding and patient with her students. However, it can be a bit difficult to understand her. Her English is not quite fluent.

Kuwai sensee is great! She is very funny and easy to get along with. Class isn't too hard, as long as you properly prepare for each class. She is easy to schedule a meeting with or go to office hours for extra pronunciation practice.

I love Kuwai-sensee! She was so funny and personable and made class fun. Although we only had her part of the time, her classes always went fastest which is good cause attendance is most of your grade. You need to read the textbook section for the day and have the conversation ready for class. She's a pretty easy grader though and helps you a lot.

Kuwai-sensei's lectures are the best. She's funny and although participation is mandatory, it's done in a way that's both fun and helps you memorize the material. Grading criteria is very clear, but you do need to prepare at least 30 minutes a day to do well in class.

Such a sweet and kind lady. She's your typically quirky Japanese and she loves to speak with her students. Given, you won't have her every class, but when you do, you know it will be fun, interactive, and actually really helpful in learning the language. Just memorize what you are supposed to (takes like 10 minutes a night) and you'll be fine.

First of all, if you take a class with Kuwai listed as professor, if it's a lower level Japanese class at least, you'll only have her about 20-40% of the time.  When you do have her, class is awesome.  When you have one of the other teachers/grad-students, it can really go either way.  But overall, you'll have a great time.

Kuwai-sensee was fantastic! She was a sweet lady who always brought her enthusiasm with her to class. The material itself is not easy and requires studying, but she is always willing to help if you ask for it. As long as you put effort into this class, you'll end up with at least a B+, if not an A.

She is actually really sweet, adorable and enthusiastic. Although it is a bit nerve racking at first because 45 classes per week are conducted completely in Japanese, class actually turns out to be fun or even funny if you study every night before class. She tells you exactly what to study and if you study it, then you will do great.

Kuwai-sensei is helpful and is not afraid to correct you so in turn don't be afraid to make mistakes. She speaks quickly and has an accent so she might be difficult to understand in English, so when she is teaching grammar make sure you read the concepts before hand. Listen to all audio and drills and do all activities mentioned in the ACT box.

Overall, I really liked having Kuwai Sensei. She sometimes got a bit confusing, and she does talk very fast. However, you could always tell she loves teaching Japanese. If you put the effort into her class she will tell, and help you out when you need help. Her quizzes are pretty easy, and are for the most part exactly what is covered in class.
She's always very enthusiastic. Her English isn't the best, but somehow she managed to get the point across, anyway. All lessons pretty much come from the book, though.

Really great class, recomend it to all those studying Japanese, really helps you learn better ways to study. Only complaint was how many times she mentioned the "how to use this textbook" section of the JSL books. These books are really different from other Japanese books and this class helps you understand them a bit more.

Had Kuwai-sensei for SPEAC J-2 (1103.02/2102.02). Frankly, I'm thankful that she taught level 2, because I'd have been so discouraged if level 3 had been my first encounter with her as a teacher. Definitely stick with it, and her teaching style will sink in. I'd say she grades as fairly as all the other teachers (Kiyosue, Terada, & Nozaki). ???????

Kuwai-sensei is dedicated to teaching students and very helpful if you're struggling to understand the material.  She has a great sense of Japanese humor which makes class lively and interesting.  The class is by no means easy, but very enjoyable.  She's definitely one of the best teachers I've ever had.

Kuwai Sensee is great--animated and makes an effort to keep students interested.  She's very willing to help students outside of class, and as many others have said, she cares about students' progress.  Fair in her grading, she constantly encourages students to improve.  She even has a Facebook fan page, Lol!
Kuwai-sensei is a wonderful teacher. She knows her stuff and knows how to teach very well. Keep in mind that the class requires a great deal of improv, so know the vocabulary that you're supposed to.

My favorite Japanese Sensee but also the one who grades the hardest. She's often very amusing and I always enjoy her lectures. She has always been very willing to meet students one-on-one outside of class too. The course is difficult but she genuinely seems to care about the students in 1st year Japanese and wants them to succeed.
Kuwai-sensei was awesome. She was so funny and helpful, and geniunely concerned for my understanding of the language.
one of my favorite teachers ever!  she is hilarious, thorough, animated, and genuinely cares about her students as people.  the best!
Very nice teacher... hilarious too.  The only thing is that her accent is hard to understand (but we have Kern-sensee so it's OK).  She helped me a lot when I was having trouble.
She is a great professor. Her accent is difficult to understand at times, but in terms of lessons she explains herself well.

She knows her stuff!  She has all the books memorized !!  She has no problem with explaining things but she gets frustrated easily.  The worst thing, she will interrupt you, constantly!  She already has a sentence in her head and you have to be a mind reader to get it right.  People either tolerate/like her or hate her, there's no inbetween.

Kuwai-sensee is probably the best teacher I've ever had. Once you've gotten used to her teaching style you always know what to expect, she is very focused and if you pay close enough attention to her exercises they are extremely beneficial. She can grade pretty hard but she'll give you the benefit of the doubt from time to time.

Yeah - she may be good one-on-one, and she may be interested in teaching.  But she cannot communicate clearly, and rather than explain she just repeats the same nonsensical BS over and over until you guess.  Guessing until you are right is not learning, it is exhausting all other options.
Excellent Instructor. She really wants to help you understand and is extremely nice. Funny too.
She's rough, but a good instructor. You know your material when she's done with you. Funny, too.
She's so nice!  The class might seem overwhelming at first, but if you stick at it, it becomes a lot easier and more fun.
Funny, intelligent, and intent on helping anyone who asks for it. Best instructor since coming to OSU.

Very Difficult!  FACT classes all in Japanese, no English (like ACT).  Fast talker, faster than Japanese fluent speakers.  Often times singles people out and 'picks' on them.  If you want to take all Japanese series, you'll eventually get her without a choice; Good luck!
Great teacher and hilarious most of the time!
hilarious, yet can make you feel pretty dumb, excellent teacher overall as after a few weeks you feel like youve learned so much
dedicated and has genuine interest in students
Extremely nice and helpful. A tad difficult to understand but she is a great teacher. Funny too.

Hard class for students who just want to get an easy A, tho her English is not that good, she's willing to help. For ppl who really wanna get to use Japanese very quick, take her class.  Her Japanese style of learning might make u feel anxious, however it's the best way to learn different system of language. It's worthful.
Took a little getting used to but has a great sense of humor and loves anyone who takes an interest in the language.
Great teacher, very funny and animated. The other instructorss are great also!
She is an awesome teacher. She's funny, explains everything well, and is willing to help anyone that wants it.
My favorite professor in my undergraduate studies at OSU

Dr. Zeidan is the man, this was my second course with him.  Students love him, he's brilliant, and is able to make boring topics more interesting through his countless personal anecdotes. Everyone at one point in their college career should have a course with a professor like Zeidan, he not only teaches course lessons but also great life lessons.
Life is short, enjoy it. You'll hear a lot of quotes from him. He wants everyone to get A or A-. but you have to show up to class and show him that you are willing to work.

Professor Zeidan is adorable. His lectures aren't always very interesting but he's very passionate about his teaching which makes you want to show up to class simply not to disappoint him. His reading assignments are interesting and he is fairly easygoing about essays (gives extensions if you're a good student and you have a legitimate reason).

Literally the most adorable and precious man ever! He is a learned man and is very well accomplished in this field. His arguments are crystal clear and sparks a genuine interest in this class. It is a one time experience to actually take this class with a professor who is truly a scholar in this field.

Most adorable man ever! He is very smart (speaks three languages) and always tells stories. He knows his books inside and out (considering he wrote the textbook) so don't bluff on your dates and spelling in essays. He is a tough grader (know dates/names/themes/etc) but I have learned a lot and enjoy him, regardless.

I do NOT recommend this professor! He is a very nice man, however, his lectures are boring and he grades really rough. He always claims at the beginning of the quarter to not want to lecture and turn the class over to us.....doesn't happen. He just goes on and on and......

This was the best class I have taken at OSU, all because of Zeidan. He is funny and very immersed in the topic, and his class was a lot of fun. If you are one of those people who simply hates school, don't take it. This class is GREAT for those who love to learn and want to expand knowledge into a great new subject. I'd recommend it to anyone! :)

is great instructor and always willing to help you outside of class. he is tough when it comes to attendance and his grading is fair. he knows his stuff when it comes to the material...very interesting..and he is funny when it comes to his joking about the middle east M. ali and not the boxer!! ha ha

Dr. Zeidan is a sweetheart. Not sure why others mentioned his lectures are boring. He is the only reason Arabic Grammar was bearable. Nice guy, knows his stuff and very funny. Don't miss his class though. He really dislikes it and will likely embarrass you the next time you show up.
Smart guy, kind of a tough grader and kind of boring

outstanding professor at a university where lib arts courses are usually pretty sad. very informative, engaging, and is extremely well-connected in his area subject. one of the best professors i have had in my academic career.
Brilliant professor, knows his stuff really well. lecutres are kind of boring. He's a very nice and funny guy. grades somewhat hard.

Interesting course, but material's "trends" tend to get monotonous and repetitive by the end.  Fair grading, and helpful when contacted outside of class.  He's very excited about the topic and he's very well respected by those in the Arabic literature world.  He's a good guy :)

She was a good professor. Did not really talk about upcoming assignments until the day before they are due. If you put in effort she will give a good grade. I preferred my other ASL professors but enjoyed the voices off rule to allow for engagement.

I had Alexa for ASL 1101 and 1103. I was so happy with her both semesters. Even with her juggling outside problems, she put her best foot forward into her work. In Deaf culture it is rude to use your voices around a Deaf person so the voices off teaches you cultural competence. Trust the process and TRY TRY TRY!! Mistakes are okay. She accepts them

Loved this class! Has it early morning and no speaking allowed which was intimidating but definitely made it that much easier to learn the language. Did as many activities as possible and forced us to use the language she was teaching us as much as possible. Had interpreters for every ICC day (like mini history/cultural lesson days). Loved it!

Alexa was a wonderful professor to have for this class. No English is allowed to be spoken, which is intimidating, but Alexa sets up PowerPoints for the class, making it really easy to learn the language. She is caring, funny, and really wants to help you learn. Easily my favorite class I took this semester.

Burry is not only a fantastic professor but a kind, caring person as well. The class is enjoyable and he genuinely cares about his students and what he is teaching. The readings were a lot to juggle at times, but overall they are pretty interesting. The two papers are not bad at all, and he is a VERY easy grader (no one got worse than a B).

Great class! Dr. Burry obviously cared a lot about his students. We had 2 papers (a 3rd extra credit one) and participation and attendance points. He was a little strict on the participation points, but he clearly says that if you participate 2-3 times per class you should be getting full or almost full credit. Would 100% take other classes of his!

Dr. Burry was an incredible professor who did everything he could to engage students in discussion of the literature we were reading. Being a literature course, there was a lot of reading, but he split it up and made it manageable. Not a super tough grader, but not a walk in the park either. Go to class and participate and you should be fine.
Absolutely great Professor. Take him if you get a chance.

Hands down best professor I've ever had at OSU (coming from a fifth year). I wish all the professors I had were just half as understanding and passionate as Dr. Burry. Not only does the guy really know his stuff, he's just a genuinely kind and understanding person. You won't have to explain yourself if you're struggling, Dr. Burry will sympathize.
I loved this class and professor.

Professor Burry is awesome! The class consisted of six reading pop quizzes, all of which had five questions about factual information from the reading. As long as you did the reading, they weren't difficult. Additionally, there were three papers, the longest being 7-8 pages. Professor Burry was always willing to meet with me to discuss my papers.

There is a solid amount of reading (15-25 pages a day), but I found it manageable. He was always very willing to engage with students and answer any questions. As long as you participate and do the reading, you should be able to get an A.

The class does require a lot of outside reading and your grade is based on only a few grades, but Dr. Burry is an excellent professor who is obviously passionate about the coursework. He is great at promoting class discussions, communicating details on assignments, and is always avaliable to offer help to any student who needs it. Take this course!

This is my third time with Professor Burry -- honestly, a treat every single time! This was a graduate-level course, the reading-load was heavy but I enjoyed most (emphasis on most) of his choices for us to read. He grades only based on a few things: 5-6 quizzes, two papers, attendance, and participation, so it's easy for your grade to fall behind.

Professor Burry was so kind! Pretty easy grader, but asks for a lot of outside reading. He does pop quizzes but always tells you the night before if you'll be having one so if you weren't prepared you can be. Very willing to help students if you ask. Since it was all online the attendance wasn't graded, but watching the lectures helped for exams.

This is my second time with Professor Burry  I think hes great. His quizzes are usually pretty self-explanatory, hes an insanely fast grader, and he gives great feedback on exams and papers (if you ask for it). The reading schedule may be a little tough to keep up with, but if you got a good schedule going, you should be fine.

Professor Burry is super nice, the class was very easy, and I really enjoyed it. The books we read were good, but it was quite a bit of reading. If you read and watched the lectures (only 15 min long), the quizzes and exams were very easy. Two exams and 1 paper made up most of the grade, but very easy if you read the books.

Hasn't properly adjusted for pandemic teaching. Pop quizzes are easy, but he is very specific for answers to a fault where it doesn't make sense. The tests make up an enormous portion of the grade. He seems like a nice guy, grades quickly, and is enthusiastic about the class. The study guide won't help. The test is overly specific. No extra credit.
My favorite professor I have taken in college. The class is fun and engaging. As long as you read the class is an easy A. The amount of reading isn't bad at all. Take this class you won't regret it.

The tests and quizzes are very straightforward. As long as so pay attention to lecture and do the readings, it won't be hard to get an A or B. The final paper isn't too bad either. He's really approachable when it comes to discussing paper ideas or the readings in general.

Take Alex's Literature class!!! So caring and sweet. The readings aren't bad at all. Go to class and take notes & read, minimal studying and you'll get an A. You don't have to like Russian to like this class or like him. Great professor

Where do I start? Dr. Burry is one of the best professors here at TOSU. During his lectures, you will be able to tell that he is very passionate about Russian literature. The only down fall is that the course is very reading dense but Dr. Burry understands that we are not all literature majors and makes the quizzes/exams straight forward!

Prof. Burry is a very enthusiastic professor and genuinely cares about his students! Make sure you attend lectures, read the assigned materials and take notes! His exams are easy and the quizzes are simple and straightforward as long as you do the readings!

Lots of reading!! But as long as you stay current on the reading you will do fine on the pop quizzes.  Make sure you pay attention to lecture,  a lot of test questions come directly from lecture.  Willing to help a student who is struggling or having difficulty with their final paper.

Professor Burry is great!  The course was reading heavy with pop quizzes.  He doesn't give prompts for the papers but he is very willing to discuss options with you and help you develop a topic/give feedback on a thesis, etc.  Definitely take advantage of it!  We had so much fun in the class, I highly recommend it.

Amazing professor. Very passionate and knowledgable on the subject of Russian Literature. Fair grader, and also very approachable/accessible outside of class, especially by email. Probably the best professor I've had at OSU, hoping I get to have him again before graduation. Get ready to read and participate in class discussions.

I can't say enough great things about Dr. Burry! He is without a doubt one of the nicest men I have ever met & will go above and beyond to help his students. He is incredibly knowledgeable, and his lectures will show that. If you do what is asked, you will have absolutely no problem getting an A in the class. He is a must take! One of the best!!!

Wonderful class and prof! His tests are really easy, and so is the final paper (5 page). Everything ended up being really easy and the clear grading criteria helped. Participation is optional since the lectures are huge. If you actually read the books then it's extremely easy to get an A. Crime and Punishment is rough.

Not a lot of grades in the class, but attendance and participation are important to getting the good grade. Likes unique ideas, especially in the papers. Only real grades for the class were some quizzes on readings and a midterm paper and final paper. Super easy if you actually do the work. Great class!
Taken for GE credit. Pretty easy A for minimal work. Lots of reading, great guy. Very down to earth professor
Really interesting lectures. Very fair professor and probably the man with the most knowledge about Russian literature at Ohio state. One of the best professors I've had.
Dr. Burry is very nice and helpful.

Took class as a literature GEC and I am not much of a reader but prof burry picks out very interesting readings and is a very good instructor. He is very clear about what you need to know and genuinely cares about students. Crime and punishment section is rough but overall a great class, I 100% recommend it!

Genuinely kind professor, very interested in helping students and seeing them succeed. There are a few books to read but if you pay attention he is extremely well spoken and clear, the class is easy if you put forth some effort. Brilliant in his field, all around ideal professor.

A brilliant, helpful, kind man. One of my favorite and one of the best teachers I have ever had at Ohio State. He made the material very interesting and really pushed everyone to do well. I wish I would have him again.

What a pleasant man! As an honors science major, I took this class as a GEC with little interest/knowledge on the subject. Entirely discussion oriented, the only grades outside discussions are 2 papers (midterm & final)...a lot of reading, but a wonderful break from hard sciences. Wonderful professor, creates a great environment for discussions.

Knows a ton about all topics Russian. Really nice and always willing to help. No textbook, but a ton of printing/online reading of articles. Open to all opinions of the articles. Good course, not so bland that you're bored to death but not too hard for a GEC.
The best class I've taken since I started college.  Awesome teacher and guy.

He is the most helpful professor you can have. He explains the text and history wonderfully and with a contagious interest. Each class is interesting. He is very open to discussions different from his views and encourages other interpretations. Exams are not too difficult if you pay attention and read the books.
Awesome, and super nice

Great teacher and really wants his students to succeed. Class is discussion based and he keeps it pretty interesting. Not really necessary to read the books, just read cliff notes and go to class and take notes. One of the best classes I've taken at OSU.

Professor Burry is one of the most helpful and dedicated professors I've had at OSU.  He knows his subject inside and out but is still very interested in his students opinions and will go above and beyond to help them succeed.  Great guy and professor.

When I had him, it was a 20/20/60 midterms and final setup. Most questions on all of the tests come from what he went over in class, which wasn't always directly having to do with the books (rather-- author info, other background, etc.) so going to class AND taking decent notes is a must. But I had fun and ended up w/ a B. He's really helpful, too.
Genuinely interested in the performance and advancement of students.  One  of the best professor I've had up to date at Ohio State.
Great proff, worked well with students and not arrogant like many others. Class was discussion based with paper final. Be able to synthesize an intelligent argument and you'll do fine.

I wasnot interested in Russian literature before the class, but now plan on reading more for my own enjoyment after the class. He is a wonderful professor who writes fair tests and is always willing to help out a student. Reading the mateiral is strongly recommended from my point of view.
Actually kept class discussion based, so if you're lazy, get to know SparkNotes. Despite being a GEC, he made it interesting. Definitely less mind-numbing than some of the other options.
Never responds to emails. Doesn't have meetings available. Can only reach her by email, but it takes her forever to respond.

I loved Rachel! OSU is a huge school but she always remembered my name! It was about 5 years ago I had her as a counselor. I always left with hope and happiness after talking with her. I sucked as a student but never felt judged by her. Amazing energy and wonderful person.

I've never had her for a class, but I always go to her instead of my actual advisor (Schwenter) when I have a question, because she is a ton more helpful than him or any of the Spanish advisors (she's technically study abroad). She really goes out of her way to help.

great teacher
Extremely helpful, great lecturer, but does expect serious effort on the part of the student (which is understandable).  AMAZING TEACHER OVERALL
I had her for Spanish 104.  She was amazing and truly interested in making sure her students understood the concepts very well!
She made the class very easy.  She genuinely cares about her students.  She's a human being.  One of the best professors I've had all around.
By far one of the best teachers i have ever had.  She was well organized and animated.  Her class was so fun, i didn't want to skip, even on nice days.
She is really interested in her students, she will do anything to help them. She is one of the best teachers I have ever had!! She makes the class interesting too!!
Awesome teacher! Made the class bearable. Very friendly and genuinely interested in her students. Would definitely recommend!

I had her for 103.66 and 104 and she is a great personality.  Very flamboyant and fun in class.  Makes up for some of the boredom and tedium that is getting through this stupid language requirement.  Great teacher in all ways.

She is very talented when it comes to explaining difficult concepts until her students can grasp them. I would gladly reccomend her to anybody looking for a 104 or 103.66 instructor.  It's not all easy, however, but only due to department mandates.
It's a hard class if you aren't a spanish genius...she expects an awful lot of her students.

When taking professor Bracamonte I really enjoyed the way that she taught spanish. As a native Spanish speaker, she understood the difficulty of speaking another language. Homework was for your own practice. When going into Spanish 1102, I looked for her as a teacher. I recommend her to anyone wanting to take Spanish.

Take her!! I took Global Citizenship with her. she does alot of in class participation/discussions, so if you dont like that vibe the class is not for you. But other than that she is very caring about her students and makes sure everyone feels welcome.

I had Janice for Italian 1102 and she was great. She made sure that all of her students were engaged in the class and learning the language. She understood that everyone had different levels of speaking, writing, and comprehension and took that into consideration throughout the semester. She is very funny and an all around great person.

Professor Aski is incredible. It is clear she truly enjoys what she does and it shows in the class lectures. Participation is a big thing in her classes along with homework. She is very approachable and willing to help if you are willing to put in the effort to learn. The best professor I had at Ohio State!

Janice was very nice but a little condescending. Willing to help, but sometimes made you feel stupid for messing up and asking questions. The homework was usually more annoying than good practice and she was constantly messing things up on Carmen like locking assignments before they were due or not allowing any submission types, but she tried hard
Does not care for her students whatsoever. HORRIBLY organized course, would not recommend.

Professor Aski is amazing. She is so easy to talk to and clearly wants the best for her students. As long as you put in the effort for the class, she will do the same. If you are struggling with any topic she will make the time to meet with you outside of class.
Great Professor! I am excited to have her again this semester. Everything is straight forward. She doesn't trick you, and is all about you constantly using italian, for your own good.
She's awesome.

Janice is incredible. She has high expectations, but will go above and beyond to help you succeed. She is kind, brilliant, and passionate about what she does. I always laughed in class and left with a smile. Take her classes!!!

Janice is a phenomenal language instructor. I teach Spanish for OSU and took two Italian classes with her to satisfy a language requirement. I learned a lot of Italian, but I also learned to be a better teacher from her example. Also, a wonderful, extremely personable lady. Highly recommended.
I will say she is my best experience at Ohio State :)
Easily one of my favorite professors. Take one of her classes, you won't regret it.
She is one of the most helpful professors ive ever had. I was dreading taking a foreign language course but she makes me actually want to go to class! Consider yourself lucky if you get in her class.
Dr. Aski is the best. Helps to have a background in linguistics before this class, but she made sure that everyone, even those with no prior knowledge, came to understand the concepts. Great class!

By far one of the best Italian professors I have had.  Her class was always interesting and entertaining as well as challenging.  She kept you awake and alert the entire time. Incredibly helpful and is flexible in schedules so you understand everything. Take one of her classes- you won't be disappointed.
She is sometimes confused, and not friendly at all.
She expects a lot, but she will bend over backward to make sure you understand.

You better know what you're doing because she is expecting it.  Aside from that she is the most helpful and one of the nicest professors I've ever had.  Just try and make an effort and you won't have a problem.  Take her class.
I had her for a really intro romance linguistics class - great class.  Very fun, and she made it accessible to non-linguists, too.
She's one of the best professors on campus.  Do yourself a favor and take her class.  She's always willing to help if you don't understand something.
She'll terrorize your papers.  EX: on a grade sheet I got a breakdown of  A, B, B, C, C  which averaged to a 70%...ouch.  She makes class very enjoyable.
Very enthusiatic.

She is an awesome professor.  Probably one of the best you will find at the university.  Take her class, you'll be glad you did.

She was a really good teacher. I always get kind of frustrated with language classes. It's a lot of work. But I went to her office hours a few times  and she was really nice and enthusiastic. She even invited people over to her house on more than one occasion.
No Comments

this professor is so upbeat that she is overbearing. her class was never fun, and it was overstructured and boring. do not schedule a class with her in the beginning of your day- she will ruin your day.

Maribel was an amazing lecturer and I truly enjoyed her class. Participation in small activities and as a whole in class is very important for her to give you a good grade on participation. Maribel is such an amazing and caring professor.  Easily one of my favorite professors. Amazing professor, she focuses a lot on speaking with your classmates in spanish which is really helpful. My favorite class I took last semester.

Professor Corona was very sweet! She really cares about her students and wants them to succeed in her class. Weekly class is mandatory, but it is really helpful in learning the language. I highly recommend taking Professor Corona!

I loved her! She has a variety of engaging activities I felt really helped me learn the language. She regularly checks in with the class to make sure we understand, and is more than happy to advocate for students. It was a small class, and she regularly tried to engage with every student. I felt like she genuinely cared about students doing well.

Very kind and good teacher. Online textbook homework is annoying but not difficult. She listens to student feedback on what to cover before tests/quizzes etc. Gives lots of helpful advice and tips before assessments - attendance is mandatory.
Although attendance is mandatory, lectures were laid back and included a lot of small group activities. She is very understanding and advocates for students when necessary.

Prof. Corona is great. She's super kind and does her best to relate to students. Asks for feedback a lot and tries to advocate for you to the SPPO department. Classes can be boring but she makes it a point to get you to work with classmates which is helpful for when you're confused or miss a day.

With the transition from In-person classes to online classes during Covid, she has tried to carry over outdated in-person teaching strategies to the online class format. Really great Spanish teacher. Spanish is her native language, so she can be hard to understand at times. She makes jokes and laughs at them, and honestly she's just so sweet and really wants her students to succeed.

Honestly the best Spanish professor. She did tons of practice during class and not only taught us Spanish, but also culture. BEST. She really cares about you trying more than actually doing things correctly. Daily homework that is based on completion only. myspanishlab has the online copy of the textbook so don't bother buying it from the bookstore and just use the link she gives you to get access much cheaper through myspanishlab

Maribel Corona was a pleasure to have. Her class was clearly defined on day 1. Every exam had a study guide that said exactly what was on each exam. There was a lot of in class participation required and daily homework. If you put in a little bit of effort, you will be fine in class. She is a very kind lady and wants the class to be enjoyable.

Maribel is an easy grader but is harsh when it comes to the attendance policy. Be sure to always have a doctor's note. She expects a lot of participation and there is more group/partner work than lecture.
She's adorable, and it makes you want to go to class. Overall easy if you like spanish. "Daily homework" and participation are easy to bulls*it your way through.

Maribel has been my least helpful and least prepared Spanish teacher. Her grading is unclear when it came to the compositions and oral exam. It seemed that she would randomly dock points. She barely taught the material and I learned most of it from the book.
Class was easy but you have to study. She was funny and she didn't speak that much Spanish during class which was nice. And she's super funny!
I'm horrible with Spanish but she'll go out of her way to help
Maribel Corona has been my favorite professor yet! She is one of the nicest women I have ever met. I actually decided to minor in Spanish for Business because I enjoyed her class so much!

She is better than some of the others but isn't great. She substitutes sweetness for clarity and only "teaches" for about 5 minutes of a 50 minute class. It is funny to hear her pronounce words differently from one sentence to the next.

Maribel was a great teacher! She was very helpful and fair in grading assignments. Just make sure you do all the homeworks and prepare for the compositions  and do a decent amount of studying and you'll do just fine. Overall class was much easier than 1102.

Maribel is awesome! Her syllabus is clear and she follows it almost exactly. She speaks only in Spanish, but she makes sure everyone is on the same page. She does an excellent job of preparing you for the SLRPE (I got 100% on both sections). Take her class! She is an excellent instructor.

The first Spanish class I took at OSU was with Maribel, and it was great! She was very helpful and knowledgeable about material.
